sourceText: Rasa'il Ikhwan al-Safa (Epistles of the Brethren of Purity)
note: Nine-level Neoplatonic emanation hierarchy from 10th-century Basra. The planets reside collectively at level 7 (World of Spheres) rather than distributing across individual levels. Influenced by Plotinus but expanded from his three hypostases to nine members.

God the Creator.description: Origin of all, beyond being — the First and only Eternal Being, from whom all else emanates by will alone

Universal Intellect.description: First emanation — contains all forms and intelligible archetypes, one in number as God is One

Universal Soul.description: Animates all reality — a simple essence emanating from the Intellect, manifests through the Sun

Prime Matter.description: Pure potentiality — spiritual substance, material substrate dependent on Intellect and Soul to receive forms

Nature.description: Active organizing principle — energy diffused through all bodies, cause of motion, life, and change

Universal Body.description: All corporeal physical substance — prime matter acquiring spatial extension and physical properties

World of Spheres.description: Intellect-animated planetary and stellar spheres — Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Sun, Venus, Mercury, Moon, composed of ether and immune to corruption

Four Elements.description: Earthbound material realm — fire, air, water, earth, subject to generation and corruption beneath the lunar sphere

Three Kingdoms.description: Mineral, plant, and animal — the composite beings of the sublunary world, formed from proportional mixtures of the four elements
